Portal 2 offers a variety of levels on which we will have to use our creativity (more or less) in order to complete the levels, even tho there's only one way to complete all the levels.

After spending 2 hours into the game, I felt bored throughout the rest, since it goes with the same pattern, solve the puzzle, go to the next one, solve the puzzzle, go to the next one, on and on.

The story itself goes more deeeper than the game actually tells you, it goes along with you with a lot of dialogues coming out of the companions you meet along the way, but don't expect them to tell you what exactly happened, take all of the information and make a conclution yourself.

I recommend this game to all new players and experienced players who haven't tried it yet, it's a classic I would say everyone must go through, try not to miss it!

Sequels usually fail to live up to the reputation of the originals the are a sequel to. [i]Portal 2[/i] is one of those rare exceptions where the sequel is actually better than the original. 

In this sequel to [i]Portal[/i], the gameplay is very similar to the original, but puzzles are more diverse, the environment is more diverse and the storyline has more depth. There also seems to be more content than in the original game, although it took me roughly the same amount of time to finish both games.

I do find the co-op missions far less interesting though, and it feels like they were thrown in as a gimmick at the end of the development cycle but didn't receive the same love and dedication the single-player version of the game got. Still, I prefer single-player games in general, and it's hard to find any flaws in the single-player part of this game. So, in spite of the somewhay disappointing co-op missions, I wholeheartedly recommend this game to anyone who likes puzzle games or FPS.

Dude, this game is fantastic. It has such replayability, it's a fantastic-looking game, the storyline gets ya right in the feels (if you've played the first game, which I also recommend), I'm surprised this game is so affordable. Like, $10 for a game of this quality?! It's amazing Valve was so generous and didn't make this, like, $50. Because $50 is the game's value but $10 is what you're paying. Absolutely incredible. 100% recommend this to anyone who hasn't played the Portal series, or anyone who hasn't played the second yet. If you've got $10 to spare, go for it. You really get what you're paying for and more.

[h1]An Easy Buy[/h1] 
If you own a steam account you should get Portal. If you have played Portal you should buy Portal 2. Its that simple. You get to play this game with a friend which is a ton of fun, both when you are working together and when you're not.

Portal 2 is pretty much the prefect sequel.
Building on the tone, gameplay and writing of the first game and improving every aspect.

I wouldn't say I'm a fan of puzzle games but when executed so expertly as this, perhaps I need to explore what else the genre has to offer! Fingers crossed for an overly ambitious third entry in the near future.

For fans of sci-fi, ingenious game design and truly unique experiences, Portal 2 is a must play.
GGWP

The Gameplay is still incredible to this day. The story is kinda vague since the player knows little to nothing about the character they are playing but it's still extremely entertaining mainly due to the other two main characters: Glados and Weathly. I find both to be extremely hilarious, espiecially when they interact with each other.
The main campaign isn't very long but the community tests and the function to create your own tests can keep you entertained for years to come. This game is a solid upgrade to Portal (1) and will (in my opinion) forever be a steam classic and something anyone with a Steam Account should've experienced at least once. That last sentence goes for the original Portal as well.
